meanings.definition: To make a formal request or demand for something.
meanings.sent1: She petitioned the principal for a longer lunch break.
meanings.sent2: The citizens petitioned the government for better healthcare.
meanings.sent3: He petitioned the cafeteria for more chocolate milk.
meanings.sent4: The students petitioned for a new playground, their voices echoing through the halls.
meanings.sent5: The workers petitioned for higher wages, their banners waving in the wind.

meanings.definition: To present a formal request to a court or other official body.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer petitioned the judge for a retrial.
meanings.sent2: The group petitioned the city council for a new community center.
meanings.sent3: She petitioned the traffic court for a reduced fine.
meanings.sent4: The protestors petitioned the assembly, their chants filling the square.
meanings.sent5: The family petitioned the court for custody, their hearts heavy with worry.

meanings.definition: To solicit or request something in a formal manner.
meanings.sent1: They petitioned the company for more flexible work hours.
meanings.sent2: The students petitioned the school board for a later start time.
meanings.sent3: He petitioned his parents for a new video game console.
meanings.sent4: The community petitioned the mayor for a new park, their voices united in purpose.
meanings.sent5: She petitioned the charity for additional funding, her passion evident in every word.
